channel.title: Web3Unchained
channel.description: Unpacking AI, Crypto & digital culture with Web3's boldest voices.
channel.itunes:author: Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, Diksha Mehra

itunes:owner.itunes:name: Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, Diksha Mehra

item.title: Michael Heinrich | Founder of 0G Labs: Building the First Modular AI Chain
item.itunes:title: Michael Heinrich | Founder of 0G Labs: Building the First Modular AI Chain
item.description:
Michael Heinrich shares his journey from high school boredom to founding 0G Labs, the first modular AI blockchain platform. He discusses how spiritual practices like meditation shaped his leadership style and contributed to his success as a founder.

Michael explains the potential of decentralized AI infrastructure and the importance of a community-owned approach for the future of AI and data. 0G Labs develops advanced AI blockchain tools and applications that connect decentralized networks to unlock data infrastructure and storage through machine learning solutions for businesses.

Join hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra for an in-depth conversation about Michael’s Web3 and AI journey.

item.title: Ethan Sun | Co-Founder of MyShell: Empowering Creators at the Blockchain-AI Crossroads
item.itunes:title: Ethan Sun | Co-Founder of MyShell: Empowering Creators at the Blockchain-AI Crossroads
item.description:
Ethan Sun shares his journey at the intersection of Blockchain and AI, and the founding story of MyShell. He explains how MyShell aims to make AI models accessible to non-technical creators, sparking a new wave in the creator economy.

Ethan also discusses the transition from Web2 to Web3, the role of blockchain in MyShell’s platform, and the unique perspective on crypto and AI from China. MyShell is building an AI consumer layer that connects users, creators, and open-source AI researchers.

Join hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra for an in-depth conversation about Ethan’s Web3 and AI founder journey.

item.title: DC Builder | Research Engineer at Worldcoin Foundation: Proving Personhood in a Digital Era
item.itunes:title: DC Builder | Research Engineer at Worldcoin Foundation: Proving Personhood in a Digital Era
item.description:
DC Builder, Research Engineer at the Worldcoin Foundation, shares insights into the project’s mission to democratize digital identity and finance worldwide while promoting fair wealth distribution. He discusses the challenges involved in verifying personhood through web of trust and biometrics, highlighting the innovative use of the Semaphore protocol.

The conversation also explores the emerging field of Zero-Knowledge Machine Learning (ZKML) and other cutting-edge crypto-AI projects reshaping the digital landscape.

Join hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra for an in-depth discussion about DC Builder’s Web3 journey.

item.title: Anna Kazlauskas | CEO and Co-Founder of Vana: Solving AI’s Data Dilemma
item.itunes:title: Anna Kazlauskas | CEO and Co-Founder of Vana: Solving AI’s Data Dilemma
item.description:
Anna Kazlauskas shares her journey from traditional finance to pioneering decentralized AI with Vana, a platform empowering people to own their data and contribute it to AI models. She highlights the critical role of tokenomics in Vana’s ecosystem and the challenges of building a Web3 company, emphasizing the importance of hiring mission-aligned team members.

Anna explores the AI data shortage and how Vana addresses it through decentralized data ownership and data DAOs. She also explains the differences between data DAOs, trusts, and unions, the value of private data, and lessons learned from projects like the Reddit Data DAO.

This episode offers valuable insights for anyone interested in the future of AI, data ownership, and Web3 innovation.

Join hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra for an in-depth conversation with Anna Kazlauskas.

item.title: Jay Jog | Co-Founder of Sei Labs: The EVM’s Dominance and Its Limitations
item.itunes:title: Jay Jog | Co-Founder of Sei Labs: The EVM’s Dominance and Its Limitations
item.description:
In this episode, Jay Jog from Sei Labs draws parallels between established cities and virtual machines, highlighting the difficulty of displacing dominant systems like the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM). He shares his journey from traditional finance at Robinhood to building Sei Network in Web3, emphasizing the importance of user feedback and the demand for higher throughput in blockchain technology.

Jay introduces parallelization as a key solution to current blockchain limitations and reflects on the cultural role of memecoins in driving community movements.

Enjoy his insightful Web3 founder journey with hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra.

item.title: Ron Bodkin | CEO and Co-Founder of Theoriq: Understanding Agent Collectives in AI
item.itunes:title: Ron Bodkin | CEO and Co-Founder of Theoriq: Understanding Agent Collectives in AI
item.description:
In this episode, Ron Bodkin explores the convergence of AI and crypto, highlighting the importance of responsibility, governance, and the transformative potential of Web3. He shares his journey from leadership roles at Google to founding Theoriq and ChainML, reflecting on the transition from corporate AI to startup innovation.

The discussion dives into agent collectives, the challenges of AI standardization, and how to measure success in decentralized AI systems. Ron introduces Proof of Contribution and Collaboration as key mechanisms for building trust in AI networks, alongside Theoriq’s foundational pillars: interoperability, composability, and decentralized innovation.

He also touches on token economics, governance structures, and company culture, closing with valuable insights on leadership and the future landscape of AI.

item.title: Karan Sirdesai | Co-Founder and CEO of Mira Network: Building Reliable AI on the Blockchain
item.itunes:title: Karan Sirdesai | Co-Founder and CEO of Mira Network: Building Reliable AI on the Blockchain
item.description:
In this episode of the Web3Unchained Podcast, Karan Sirdesai, Co-Founder and CEO of Mira Network, shares his journey and the mission to build a decentralized AI infrastructure platform focused on creating reliable and safe artificial intelligence.

Karan discusses how Mira addresses the critical challenge of AI hallucinations, enhancing trustworthiness for high-stakes applications in finance, healthcare, and beyond. He reflects on his non-linear founder journey, from hustling during university and collaborating with Balaji Srinivasan, to founding Mira with a team of deep AI and crypto experts.

Listeners will learn about Mira’s breakthrough “aha” moment, discovered through hands-on experimentation with GPU rentals and AI pipelines, leading to an innovative solution involving multiple AI models and consensus-based verification.

Join us for an insightful conversation about pioneering trust and reliability in AI on the blockchain.

item.title: David Minarsch | Co-Founder & CEO of Valory: The Rise of Autonomous Agents and the Future of Web3
item.itunes:title: David Minarsch | Co-Founder & CEO of Valory: The Rise of Autonomous Agents and the Future of Web3
item.description:
Join David Minarsch as he delves into the concept of autonomy and its transformative impact on human-machine relationships. He shares his journey through the crypto and AI spaces, including his work with Fetch.ai and the founding of Valory and OLAS.

This conversation explores the rise of autonomous agents, their practical use cases, and the challenges faced in the evolving Web3 AI landscape. David also highlights the importance of mission-driven teams and the open-source ethos behind OLAS, which is designed to efficiently coordinate decentralized autonomous agents.

Tune in to hear David’s founder journey with hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra.

item.title: Uma Roy | Co-Founder of Succinct Labs: Why Zero Knowledge is Key to Scaling Crypto
item.itunes:title: Uma Roy | Co-Founder of Succinct Labs: Why Zero Knowledge is Key to Scaling Crypto
item.description:
In this episode, Uma Roy, Co-Founder of Succinct Labs, shares her journey into the Web3 space and the vision behind founding Succinct Labs. She highlights the critical role of zero-knowledge proofs (ZKPs) in enhancing the scalability and privacy of crypto projects.

Uma discusses the origins and growth of Succinct Labs in San Francisco, emphasizing the team’s preference for in-person collaboration. She also dives into the technical challenges they faced while developing SP1, a zero-knowledge virtual machine, and how they overcame those obstacles.

Join hosts Kenzi Nakamura and Diksha Mehra for an in-depth conversation about Uma’s journey as a Web3 founder and the future of zero-knowledge technology in crypto.

item.title: Rushi Manche | Co-Founder of Movement Labs: Inside the Mind of a Gen Z Web3 Founder
item.itunes:title: Rushi Manche | Co-Founder of Movement Labs: Inside the Mind of a Gen Z Web3 Founder
item.description:
In this episode, Rushi Manche, Co-Founder of Movement Labs, shares his inspiring journey from a young coder to a pioneering crypto innovator. He talks about the value of investing your time and skills to build experience, the rise and impact of meme coins, and how Gen Z marketing is reshaping the crypto landscape.

Rushi also explains how Movement Labs is making Ethereum more secure and accessible through the introduction of the Move language and technology. The conversation dives deep into what Gen Z founders need to succeed in the rapidly evolving Web3 space.

Join hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra for an insightful discussion about Rushi’s Web3 founder journey and the future of blockchain innovation.

item.title: Gabby Dizon | Co-Founder of Yield Guild Games: Tokenomics and In-Game Economies
item.itunes:title: Gabby Dizon | Co-Founder of Yield Guild Games: Tokenomics and In-Game Economies
item.description:
In this episode, Gabby Dizon, Co-Founder of Yield Guild Games (YGG), shares his journey from a PC gamer to a Web3 pioneer. He discusses the challenges and future of Web3 gaming, highlighting the transformative potential of AI and the essential qualities founders need to succeed in this space.

Gabby provides insight into the evolution of YGG, including their innovative on-chain guilds, and explores what it will take for Web3 games to achieve mainstream adoption.

With over 18 years in the gaming industry, Gabby co-founded Yield Guild Games, a play-to-earn gaming guild and decentralized autonomous organization (DAO). YGG empowers gamers worldwide by providing access to NFT game assets necessary to participate in blockchain games and earn crypto rewards. He is also a founding board member of the Blockchain Game Alliance.

Gabby’s mission is to onboard millions of gamers to discover new opportunities in the digital world, believing that the future of work lies within the open Metaverse.

Join hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra for an in-depth conversation about Gabby’s Web3 founder journey and the future of gaming.

item.title: Greg Osuri | Founder of Akash Network: Liberty, Community, and the Future of Decentralized AI
item.itunes:title: Greg Osuri | Founder of Akash Network: Liberty, Community, and the Future of Decentralized AI
item.description:
In this episode, Greg Osuri, Founder and CEO of Akash Network, dives into the meaning of liberty, sovereignty, and freedom in the context of the decentralized web. He shares his founder journey, the obstacles he’s overcome, and why community remains at the heart of Web3 innovation.

Greg reflects on the experience of building in Web3, the shift from Web2 models, and the importance of maintaining a healthy work-life balance as a founder. He also discusses the power of open-source technology, the growing relevance of decentralized AI, and how governments may shape its development moving forward.

As the visionary behind Akash Network, Greg is helping redefine the future of cloud computing through decentralization. Before launching Akash, he founded AngelHack, the world’s largest hackathon network with over 100,000 developers across 50 cities. Earlier in his career, he worked at IBM and went on to design Kaiser Permanente’s first cloud architecture.

Enjoy this in-depth conversation with hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra, as Greg shares his perspective on the convergence of Web3 and AI—and his mission to build infrastructure that preserves freedom and access for all.

item.title: Richard Ma | Co-Founder & CEO of Quantstamp: Securing the Future of Web3
item.itunes:title: Richard Ma | Co-Founder & CEO of Quantstamp: Securing the Future of Web3
item.description:
In this episode, Richard Ma, Co-Founder and CEO of Quantstamp, shares his transition from the hedge fund world to Web3, and the founding story behind one of the most prominent blockchain security firms in the space. He breaks down how Quantstamp operates, the evolving nature of its customer base, and what truly sets successful Web3 startups apart in the long term.

Quantstamp is a global leader in blockchain security, dedicated to securing the future of Web3. The company has performed over 500 audits, securing more than $200 billion in digital assets from potential exploits and vulnerabilities.

Before founding Quantstamp, Richard was a software engineer at Tower Research, where he built and tested high-performance financial systems. After personally experiencing the fallout from The DAO hack, he was inspired to launch Quantstamp to improve the standards of security auditing across blockchain ecosystems.

Join hosts Kenzi Nakamura and Diksha Mehra for an insightful conversation with Richard about the importance of security in Web3, lessons learned from early Ethereum events, and what it takes to build trust and resilience in decentralized systems.

item.title: David Tse | Co-Founder of BabylonChain: Scaling Bitcoin to Secure a Decentralized World
item.itunes:title: David Tse | Co-Founder of BabylonChain: Scaling Bitcoin to Secure a Decentralized World
item.description:
In this episode, David Tse, Co-Founder of BabylonChain, discusses how staking can unlock a new era for Bitcoin by expanding its role in the broader decentralized ecosystem. He shares the founding story of BabylonChain and his journey from academic research to becoming a Web3 founder.

BabylonChain enables Bitcoin holders to earn yield on their idle BTC—securely and without third-party trust or bridging to other chains. By locking their Bitcoin in a self-custodial manner, users gain the ability to validate Proof-of-Stake (PoS) chains and earn rewards in return.

David Tse is a renowned professor at Stanford University, with a distinguished background in wireless communication, genomics, and blockchain technology. He is also an advisor to Bain Capital Crypto, offering strategic insights at the intersection of cryptography, protocol design, and scalable systems.

Tune in for an in-depth conversation with hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra, as David explores the future of Bitcoin staking, the design philosophy behind BabylonChain, and what it takes to bridge rigorous academic research with real-world blockchain innovation.

item.title: Sergey Gorbunov | Co-Founder of Axelar Network: Scaling Interoperability in Blockchain
item.itunes:title: Sergey Gorbunov | Co-Founder of Axelar Network: Scaling Interoperability in Blockchain
item.description:
In this episode, Sergey Gorbunov, Co-Founder of Axelar Network, discusses the future of blockchain interoperability, the founding journey of Axelar, and what drives him to keep innovating in the Web3 space.

Axelar is a programmable Web3 interoperability platform that enables seamless cross-chain communication, aiming to scale the next generation of internet applications to billions of users.

Sergey brings a strong academic and technical background to the space. He’s also an Assistant Professor at the University of Waterloo, a former founding team member at Algorand, and holds a Ph.D. from MIT, where he was a Microsoft Ph.D. Fellow. His dissertation focused on developing cryptographic tools for the cloud using lattice-based cryptography.

Join hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra for a deep conversation with Sergey about interoperability as infrastructure, the role of cryptography in Web3, and the mindset required to build across chains.

item.title: Victor Ji | Co-Founder of Manta Network: Building Real-World Use Cases with Zero Knowledge
item.itunes:title: Victor Ji | Co-Founder of Manta Network: Building Real-World Use Cases with Zero Knowledge
item.description:
In this episode, Victor Ji, Co-Founder of Manta Network, explores the power of Zero-Knowledge (ZK) proofs and how Manta is redefining the developer experience for ZK applications. He walks through key milestones in Manta's journey and shares what it takes to succeed as a Web3 founder.

Manta Network is focused on building a secure, interoperable future using ZK technology, with a mission to provide the best developer experience for creating and deploying zero-knowledge applications.

Before founding Manta in 2020, Victor worked as a Research Assistant at Harvard’s Belfer Center, where he developed deep expertise in international security, diplomacy, and technology policy. His unique background bridges both the academic and crypto worlds.

Join hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra for a compelling conversation about the origins of Manta Network, the practical use cases of ZK technology, and the mindset needed to build in Web3.

item.title: Sandy Peng | Co-Founder of Scroll: Building Layer 2 Solutions Aligned with the Ethereum Roadmap
item.itunes:title: Sandy Peng | Co-Founder of Scroll: Building Layer 2 Solutions Aligned with the Ethereum Roadmap
item.description:
In this episode, Sandy Peng, Co-Founder of Scroll, dives into the world of Layer 2 scaling solutions in Web3, sharing the founding story of Scroll and her approach to building successful blockchain projects by staying focused on execution.

Scroll is a community-first, native zkEVM Layer 2 solution—an open-source initiative that operates at the cutting edge of zero-knowledge (ZK) research. Sandy brings a wealth of experience across research, business development, and strategy. With a background as both a startup founder and blockchain investor, she offers rare insights into the development, regulation, and real-world application of blockchain and open-source technologies.

Join hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra for a deep conversation with Sandy about her Web3 founder journey, the early days of building Scroll, and what it takes to innovate within the Ethereum ecosystem.

item.title: Chris Spadafora | Founder of BadgerDAO: Bringing Bitcoin to DeFi
item.itunes:title: Chris Spadafora | Founder of BadgerDAO: Bringing Bitcoin to DeFi
item.description:
In this episode, Chris Spadafora, founder of BadgerDAO, shares insights into decentralized governance, the challenges of crypto tribalism, and his mission to bring Bitcoin into the DeFi ecosystem.

BadgerDAO is an open-source, decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) focused on enabling the use of Bitcoin as collateral across decentralized finance (DeFi) applications. The platform is governed by its native token, BADGER, which empowers community members to vote on key proposals. Voting power is proportional to the amount of BADGER held, and approved proposals are implemented directly by the DAO.

Chris also reflects on the origin and evolution of BadgerDAO, and his personal journey as a Web3 founder.

Tune in for a compelling conversation with hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra

item.title: Eli Ben-Sasson | Founder of StarkWare: Scaling Blockchain with Zero-Knowledge
item.itunes:title: Eli Ben-Sasson | Founder of StarkWare: Scaling Blockchain with Zero-Knowledge
item.description:
Eli Ben-Sasson, the co-founder and President of StarkWare, shares insights into his journey into the Web3 space, the challenges of blockchain scalability, and how StarkWare is working to onboard the next billion users onto the blockchain. StarkWare is pioneering the use of zero-knowledge proof technology to compress data, addressing some of the fundamental scalability issues that blockchains face today.

Before co-founding StarkWare, Eli's academic career was marked by notable achievements, including earning a Ph.D. under Abel Prize laureate Avi Wigderson. He then completed his postdoctoral work at both MIT and Harvard, focusing on probabilistically checkable proofs (PCPs). It was during the 2013 Bitcoin conference that Eli first realized how his research could contribute to solving critical problems in blockchain technology.

Today, StarkWare stands at the forefront of blockchain innovation, with three groundbreaking technologies that are reshaping the space and driving its future forward. But Eli sees one of the greatest challenges ahead: maintaining the decentralization of blockchain. "Whenever a system becomes valuable, there are always parties that benefit and seek to consolidate control. The essence of blockchain and Web3 lies in resisting that centralization and ensuring the distribution of power across society. It's a challenge we have yet to fully solve, but it's critical for the long-term future of the technology," Eli explains.

In this in-depth conversation with hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra, Eli delves into StarkWare's journey, the potential of zero-knowledge proofs, and his vision for the future of Web3. Join them as they explore how scaling blockchain with zero-knowledge proofs can unlock the next era of decentralized innovation.

item.title: Sreeram Kannan | Founder of EigenLayer: Blockchain Brings Trust to Tech Innovation
item.itunes:title: Sreeram Kannan | Founder of EigenLayer: Blockchain Brings Trust to Tech Innovation
item.description:
In this episode of Web3Unchained, we sit down with Sreeram Kannan, Co-Founder and CEO of EigenLayer, as he shares his unique journey from academia to building impactful blockchain products. Sreeram delves into why he chose to leave his academic career behind and embark on an entrepreneurial journey in the Web3 space, driven by a deep belief in the power of blockchain technology to democratize innovation and empower individuals to create value.

Sreeram explains, "This idea that as an innovator, you don’t need to bring trust. You only need to bring your innovation, and that the blockchain brings the trust, is such a mind-bending idea that enables a whole new generation of people to actually come in and create systems."

Before launching EigenLayer, Sreeram developed two blockchain products, but it was EigenLayer's innovative concept of restaking that truly captured his attention. The protocol allows Ethereum stakers to make additional promises beyond the Ethereum protocol, unlocking new possibilities in the blockchain space. EigenLayer’s platform also facilitates on-chain computation for high-throughput applications, such as social media and gaming use cases, paving the way for the future of scalable decentralized applications.

Tune in to learn how EigenLayer is tackling some of the biggest challenges in the crypto ecosystem and why Sreeram believes blockchain is the key to unleashing tech innovation in the Web3 era.

item.title: Aniket Jindal | Co-Founder of Biconomy: Building Tools to Make Web3 Accessible to Everyone
item.itunes:title: Aniket Jindal | Co-Founder of Biconomy: Building Tools to Make Web3 Accessible to Everyone
item.description:
In this episode of Web3Unchained, we sit down with Aniket Jindal, Co-Founder of Biconomy, as he shares his journey into the Web3 space and the qualities that define successful Web3 founders. Aniket discusses the dynamics of bear markets, the critical role of community management, and why user experience (UX) is key to the success of blockchain technology.

Biconomy is a multi-chain relay infrastructure and transaction network designed to make Web3 more user-friendly, accessible, and affordable. Aniket walks us through the challenges of crypto adoption, and how Biconomy is simplifying the user experience to make it easier for anyone to interact with decentralized applications. The team’s vision is to remove barriers that hinder the mass adoption of blockchain technology.

Aniket also shares pivotal lessons from Biconomy’s growth, from Polygon adoption to the importance of staying connected with customers. His insights provide a fresh perspective on building products that bridge the gap between the complexities of Web3 and the everyday user.

item.title: Beryl Li | Co-Founder of Yield Guild Games: From Games to Guilds - Navigating the Web3 Journey
item.itunes:title: Beryl Li | Co-Founder of Yield Guild Games: From Games to Guilds - Navigating the Web3 Journey
item.description:
In this episode of Web3Unchained, we sit down with Beryl Li, Co-Founder of Yield Guild Games (YGG)—the largest decentralized network of gaming guilds in the Web3 space. Beryl takes us through her unique journey into Web3, sharing her insights on how guilds are reshaping the future of blockchain gaming, and how education and community play a crucial role in driving the adoption of blockchain technology.

YGG has revolutionized the gaming landscape, offering a platform that connects both gamers and blockchain enthusiasts while focusing on Web3 education and blockchain games. As the guild continues to grow, Beryl highlights the significance of native tokens in enabling decentralized gaming ecosystems, and the intricacies of managing such a vast and decentralized community.

Beryl's leadership in the Web3 space has earned her significant recognition. She’s been named one of J.P. Morgan's Top 100 Women-Powered Businesses in the Asia-Pacific region and is part of the inaugural cohort of Technology Pioneers and Unicorns at the World Economic Forum. Her journey serves as an inspiration, particularly for women-of-color founders navigating the Web3 world.

item.title: Ryan Kim | Partner at Hashed: Cracking the Code on Web3 Investments in Asia
item.itunes:title: Ryan Kim | Partner at Hashed: Cracking the Code on Web3 Investments in Asia
item.description:
In this episode of Web3Unchained, we speak with Ryan Sungho Kim, a Partner at Hashed, a leading blockchain firm in Asia. Ryan specializes in Web3 investments across Asia, focusing on applications, corporate finance, and enterprise solutions.

Before joining Hashed, Ryan successfully exited his company, LOOKET—a mobile solution for SMEs—selling it to Recobell, a big data company. His work on developing recommendation systems in his previous venture revealed deep vulnerabilities in the data space, which ultimately led him to explore blockchain technology. This passion for decentralized solutions played a pivotal role in his decision to co-found Hashed.

Founded in 2017 by a team of serial entrepreneurs and engineers, Hashed has grown into the preeminent blockchain firm in Asia, with a diverse portfolio spanning the globe. Ryan shares his vision for the future of blockchain, explaining, "We saw an opportunity for blockchain to not only reinvent the global financial system, but the very fabric of the internet itself. This is one of the most consequential moments in human history—a chance to overlay the power of digital networks onto human ones, and to usher in a future where technology empowers individuals, not the other way around."

item.title: Jeff “Jiho” Zirlin | Co-Founder of Axie Infinity: Turning Your Web3 Community into True Evangelists
item.itunes:title: Jeff “Jiho” Zirlin | Co-Founder of Axie Infinity: Turning Your Web3 Community into True Evangelists
item.description:
In this episode of Web3Unchained, hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra chat with Jiho about his early days in the Web3 space, and the journey of building Axie Infinity and Sky Mavis with co-founders Trung Nguyen, Tu Doan, Aleksander Larsen, and Andy Ho. Jiho reflects on the early challenges of building in a bear market—when they were “small and unrecognized” but still confident in their vision, team, and community.

A central theme of their journey was creating a Web3 community that not only rewarded technical knowledge but also encouraged learning. Jiho sums up their founding principle: “Something that can play into childhood nostalgia is going to be a compelling way to educate people on Web3.”

As the conversation progresses, Jiho dives into some of the biggest lessons from Axie Infinity’s growth, including working with the community on managing expectations around product features. One of his key insights is: “How do you turn your community into your best evangelists? How do you have them doing the things that are most beneficial for the network, which ultimately benefits everybody? Understanding aligned incentives, different economic models, and the cold start problem is crucial for Web3 startups.”

Today, Axie Infinity is one of the largest Play2Earn NFT games in the crypto space. Recently, Sky Mavis closed a $152 million Series B round, bringing the company's valuation to a staggering $3 billion.

item.title: Yat Siu | Co-Founder of Animoca Brands: The North Star of Web3 is Digital Ownership
item.itunes:title: Yat Siu | Co-Founder of Animoca Brands: The North Star of Web3 is Digital Ownership
item.description:
In this episode, Yat Siu, Co-Founder of Animoca Brands, takes us through his fascinating journey from aspiring musician to tech entrepreneur and Web3 pioneer. From his early days writing software on his Atari ST in the 1980s to his ventures that shaped the digital landscape, Yat’s story is a testament to innovation and perseverance.

Coming from a family of musicians, Yat initially trained to be a musician. However, his passion for technology led him to create software to read music notations. While it didn’t win him any praise from his teachers, it quickly found an audience, leading to his first entrepreneurial venture. His knack for innovation eventually landed him roles at Atari, Silicon Graphics, and AT&T.

In the late '90s, Yat founded Hong Kong Cybercity, the first free web page and e-mail provider in Asia, later rebranded as Freenation. His foray into Web3 was, therefore, almost destined. In 2014, he co-founded Animoca Brands, a company now known for integrating blockchain and artificial intelligence into gaming and digital products. The key turning point for Animoca was the realization that NFTs enabled true digital ownership of assets—a belief that would drive the company's pivot to blockchain.

Yat explains: “It’s a belief and conviction that came from a theory we had, which is ownership. That’s why we always talked about digital ownership, which eventually became treated as property rights back in 2018. The principle of ownership creates network effects, and as people build and compose on top of it, the system becomes so large and robust that it essentially becomes unstoppable.”

item.title: Lily Liu | President of The Solana Foundation: Why Blockchain Ecosystems Are More Like Cities Than Companies
item.itunes:title: Lily Liu | President of The Solana Foundation: Why Blockchain Ecosystems Are More Like Cities Than Companies
item.description:
In this episode, we’re joined by Lily Liu, the President of the Solana Foundation and a seasoned entrepreneur and investor in the cryptocurrency space. Lily brings a wealth of experience from her roles as a CFO and operating executive across the US, China, and emerging markets. She is also the Co-Founder of Anagram, part of the founding team of Osmosis, and an advisor to Brave. Previously, she co-founded Earn.com, which was acquired by Coinbase in 2018.

Lily's perspective on blockchain ecosystems is one that challenges traditional views. She believes that blockchain ecosystems are more like cities than companies, emphasizing how decentralized networks thrive when they operate with autonomy and community-driven goals. “Trying to operate a blockchain like a company is where things start and end in terms of being successful in Web3,” she explains.

Tune in to hear Lily's remarkable journey—from initial skepticism to groundbreaking success in the crypto space—and gain valuable insights into how blockchain ecosystems are reshaping the future of decentralized technology.

item.title: Jaynti Kanani | Co-Founder of Polygon: From Underdog to Champion
item.itunes:title: Jaynti Kanani | Co-Founder of Polygon: From Underdog to Champion
item.description:
Polygon’s rise in the world of crypto is nothing short of extraordinary—a true underdog story that has become one of the biggest success tales in the tech industry. In this episode, Jaynti "JD" Kanani, Co-Founder of Polygon, shares his inspiring journey from humble beginnings to building one of the most influential blockchain ecosystems.

At the heart of JD's belief in Web3 is a simple but powerful philosophy: all you need is a laptop and an internet connection to build anything. As JD puts it, “You don’t need to be out there; you don’t have to put your name or face anywhere. You don’t have to go to Stanford or any big college. You don’t even have to go to school to be in Web3, because I see people in smaller villages from India building on Web3.”

item.title: Illia Polosukhin | Co-Founder of NEAR Protocol: Scaling an L1 in a Bear Market
item.itunes:title: Illia Polosukhin | Co-Founder of NEAR Protocol: Scaling an L1 in a Bear Market
item.description:
In this week’s episode of Web3Unchained, hosts Kenzi Nakamura and Diksha Mehra chat with Illia Polosukhin, Co-Founder of NEAR Protocol, to explore the journey of building a next-gen Layer 1 blockchain. Illia dives deep into the creation of NEAR, its vision for true scalability in Web3, and how the protocol is designed to overcome the challenges of mass adoption.

He also shares his insights on navigating and building through a bear market, offering valuable lessons on staying resilient and focused while the industry faces downturns. Whether you're building an L1 or working in the Web3 ecosystem, this episode provides a fresh perspective on sustainable growth in crypto.

item.title: Alex Svanevik | Co-Founder of Nansen: From Data Scientist to Web3 Founder
item.itunes:title: Alex Svanevik | Co-Founder of Nansen: From Data Scientist to Web3 Founder
item.description: In this episode, Alex Svanevik, Co-Founder of Nansen.ai, takes us through his journey from data scientist to Web3 founder. Alex shares how his background in data science laid the foundation for building Nansen, a powerful on-chain analytics platform that helps users make informed decisions in the world of Web3. He dives into the business model behind Nansen, detailing how the platform combines cutting-edge data insights with user-centric design to scale successfully in the Web3 space.

item.title: Matthew Gould | Founder & CEO of Unstoppable Domains: Building a Web3 Unicorn Without a Token
item.itunes:title: Matthew Gould | Founder & CEO of Unstoppable Domains: Building a Web3 Unicorn Without a Token
item.description: In this episode of Web3Unchained, Kenzi Nakamura, Sachi Tanaka, and Diksha Mehra speak to Matthew Gould, the CEO of Unstoppable Domains. He discusses building a digital identity-focused Web3 company, what founders need to focus on for fundraising, and why he thinks token funding may be harmful to protocols. Here is a deep dive into the conversation, featuring edited excerpts from the podcast.

item.title: Harsh Rajat | Founder of Push Protocol: Web3 Market Sentiment, Raising Funds, & L1 Wars
item.itunes:title: Harsh Rajat | Founder of Push Protocol: Web3 Market Sentiment, Raising Funds, & L1 Wars
item.description:
In this episode of Web3Unchained, hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Diksha Mehra, and Sachi Tanaka sit down with Harsh Rajat, the Founder of Push Protocol, a groundbreaking communication protocol designed for Web3. Push Protocol enables cross-chain notifications and messaging for dapps, wallets, and services tied to wallet addresses, allowing seamless communication across decentralized ecosystems.

Harsh shares the journey of Push Protocol, including how they approached the Ethereum Foundation for funding and the critical lessons learned in the process of community building. He also touches on the dynamics of the Layer 1 (L1) wars and how different ecosystems are shaping the future of Web3. Additionally, he reflects on the importance of mentors within the crypto ecosystem and what they've learned along the way.

item.title: Jack Lu | Co-Founder of Magic Eden: Going Multi-Chain, Building for Web3, and the Future of NFTs
item.itunes:title: Jack Lu | Co-Founder of Magic Eden: Going Multi-Chain, Building for Web3, and the Future of NFTs
item.description:
In this episode of Web3Unchained, hosts Kenzi Nakamura, Diksha Mehra, and Sachi Tanaka sit down with Jack Lu, CEO and one of the four co-founders of Magic Eden, the leading NFT marketplace that has quickly become a household name in the Web3 space.

Before launching Magic Eden, Jack worked at industry giants like FTX, Google, and Boston Consulting Group. With his wealth of experience, he co-founded Magic Eden in September 2021, initially focused on Solana-based NFTs. However, recognizing the rapidly evolving space, Magic Eden made a strategic pivot to become multi-chain, integrating Ethereum and, later in November 2022, Polygon.

In this episode, Jack shares how Magic Eden's approach to the NFT marketplace has evolved, with a strong emphasis on building creator- and community-centric tools. He also discusses the platform’s game-changing Launchpad feature, which simplifies the process for creators to mint, market, and successfully launch their NFT projects. With a clear vision for the future, Magic Eden is positioning itself as a key player in the multi-chain future of Web3.

item.title: Chris Gonsalves | CEO of Community Gaming: Web3 Gaming Ecosystems and eSports
item.itunes:title: Chris Gonsalves | CEO of Community Gaming: Web3 Gaming Ecosystems and eSports
item.description:
In this week’s episode of Web3Unchained, hosts Kenzi Nakamura and Diksha Mehra sit down with Chris Gonsalves, CEO of Community Gaming, to explore the intersection of Web3 and eSports. Chris takes us through the origins of Community Gaming, how the Web3 gaming ecosystem is reshaping the landscape of competitive gaming, and what sets it apart from traditional eSports models.

He also shares his thoughts on how Web3 gaming will evolve in the future, offering a glimpse into the potential of decentralized gaming platforms and what they mean for players, developers, and fans alike.

item.title: Sandeep Nailwal | Co-Founder of Polygon: Setbacks, Community Building, and Rebranding Polygon
item.itunes:title: Sandeep Nailwal | Co-Founder of Polygon: Setbacks, Community Building, and Rebranding Polygon
item.description:
In this episode of Web3Unchained, hosts Kenzi Nakamura and Diksha Mehra sit down with Sandeep Nailwal, Co-Founder of Polygon, to explore his remarkable journey in the world of Web3. Sandeep shares how he first got into crypto, the challenges and setbacks faced along the way, and how Polygon evolved from a scaling solution into one of the most recognized names in blockchain.

He also opens up about his deep commitment to the developer community, the strategic rebranding of Polygon, and his vision for the future of Web3. Whether you're a founder, builder, or enthusiast, this conversation offers a raw and inspiring look behind the scenes of one of crypto’s biggest success stories.

item.title: Lucas Vogelsang | Co-Founder of Centrifuge: The Future of DeFi
item.itunes:title: Lucas Vogelsang | Co-Founder of Centrifuge: The Future of DeFi
item.description:
In this episode of Web3Unchained, hosts Kenzi Nakamura and Diksha Mehra sit down with Lucas Vogelsang, CEO and Co-Founder of Centrifuge, a pioneer in bringing Real World Assets (RWAs) into DeFi since Ethereum’s early days. The conversation dives deep into the evolving landscape of decentralized finance, the potential of the Polkadot ecosystem, and what it takes to build and sustain a Web3 startup during a bear market.

Lucas’s journey began with a lifelong passion for computers and coding. After spending seven years in the tech industry, he had a bold vision in 2017: to transform traditional finance by using blockchain technology as the foundation for secure, transparent financial transactions. That vision led to the creation of Centrifuge—a platform designed to unlock capital and connect real-world assets with decentralized finance.

item.title: Nischal Shetty | Founder of Shardeum: Building in Web3 and the Importance of Community
item.itunes:title: Nischal Shetty | Founder of Shardeum: Building in Web3 and the Importance of Community
item.description:
In this episode of Web3Unchained, hosts Kenzi Nakamura and Diksha Mehra speak with Nischal Shetty, Founder of WazirX and Shardeum, about decentralization, building strong communities the right way, and succeeding in the Web3 space.

Before launching WazirX and Shardeum, Nischal began his entrepreneurial journey in 2010 with a social media management platform. What started as JustUnfollow later evolved into Crowdfire. At the time, Nischal was a full-time software developer who dedicated weekends and spare hours to building his app. The idea behind it was simple but powerful: help users manage all their social media accounts—like Instagram and Facebook—from a single dashboard. The app struck a chord and grew rapidly, eventually reaching 20 million users.

However, by 2017, major social networks began implementing restrictive policy changes that impacted third-party apps like Crowdfire. This experience opened Nischal’s eyes to the vulnerabilities of building on centralized platforms. As a result, he made a pivotal decision: his future ventures would be built on decentralized infrastructure.
